title: What Should I Build?
description: Exploring product directions in the personal AI space.

nodes.content: Started by listing everything that frustrates me about current AI tools: no memory continuity, no data ownership, no cross-platform context.
Deep dive into MCP specification. It's the right abstraction layer. The question is: what's the "personal" MCP server?
Key insight from conversation with Alex: "The data isn't the model. If you separate data sovereignty from model choice, you unlock something fundamentally new."
Explored three directions: (A) Personal memory layer, (B) Intent management system, (C) Full PI kernel with Person/Intent/Relation ontology. C is the most ambitious but also the most defensible.
CONVERGENCE: Building a "Self Kernel" â€” a local-first, white-box personal intelligence core. Three atomic objects: Person, Intent, Relation. Exposed as MCP server.
